'''Airefëa''' is the [[Quenya]] name for the '''[[Wikipedia:Holy Spirit in Christianity|Holy Spirit]]''', the Third Person of the [[Eru|Blessed Trinity]] in [[Christianity]]. The term only appears in the ''[[Alcar i Ataren]]'' ([[:Wikipedia:Gloria Patri|Gloria Patri]]) prayer, translated by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in [[1950]]s. It is clearly a compound of ''[[airë]]'' ("holy") + ''[[fëa]]'' ("spirit").<ref name=Airefea>{{VT|43a}}, pp. 36-8</ref>

The term in the text was emended from ''fairë aista''. As the editors point out, the term ''fëa'' in the [[legendarium]] is applied to the [[Incarnate]], while the term ''[[fairë]]'' is rather applied to (disembodied) [[spirits]] in general, but both terms meant originally "radiance".<ref name=Airefea/>

In addition, Tolkien explicitely identified the '''[[Secret Fire]]''' from his [[legendarium]] with the Holy Spirit.<ref>[[Clyde S. Kilby]], ''[[Tolkien and The Silmarillion]]'', "Tolkien as Christian Writer", p. 59</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In the ''[[Qenya Lexicon]]'', the [[Qenya]] term '''''Sâ''''' is glossed as "Fire, especially in temples, etc. A mystic name identified with Holy Ghost".<ref>{{PE|12}}, p. 81, entry "SAHA"</ref>
